ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: The course was a virtual lab with the occasional breakout room for some lab activities.

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about some basic scientific phenomena, such as enzymes and the lac operon. I was able to develop some scientific writing skills. The workshop on EndNote was immensely useful. I think the largest skill I learned was how to use GIS (geographic information system) and build a map.

Even though the lab was online, Dr. Moreno made the virtual experience as close to an in-person one as possible. I felt like I took away the conceptual and practical understandings that we covered in the course and did so well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths of the course were the commitment of Professor Moreno and the TFs. I appreciated how they tried to include skills that we can take away with and use after this semester is over, such as GraphPad Prism, EndNote, Miro, and ArcGIS. These skills along with writing skills in the lab reports can be used translationally. The effort of Dr. Moreno to create videos of the laboratory techniques and explain them was very useful and informational. With that said, I wish that more feedback could be provided in the assignments. I felt very lost about what was expected, especially for the lab report, and the feedback was not very specific, making me confused. I would have appreciated a sample lab report, even if we are supposed to develop our own writing style. For the GIS workshops, I thought some of them were not useful, and even then, I think we were confused what we were supposed to do each week and how to continue. Some of the activities felt like busy work. I think overall, this could be improved with more clear expectations and specific feedback along with more clear organization. Still, this course was extremely helpful.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course succeeded in providing useful skills that students can take away, whether it is writing, making figures, different techniques, and mapping. The movies of the laboratory techniques and explanation of the techniques were useful. I think the course was adapted as best it could for a lab that was virtual.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this course to another student if you are looking to learn skills that will help in biology and science. This lab course is a very strong foundation to skills that will be used in the future. You learn a lot of foundational information as well as mapping.
Yes! Especially to students who want to solidify their understanding of foundational biology concepts and their practical applications.
